intro: Dorstenia mannii var. mungensis, commonly known as the Mungense milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation, a common trait among members of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
